poem:
Title: Farewell to Quickened Groceries

Pedalled triumphs o'er many a land,
Yet now, to Turkish soil return, headquarters stand.
Grocery courier, tired and dusty,
Where once was bountiful, now merely crusty.
Covid's haste fades, like spring into summer's warming,
Fast delivery's charm, in light of day, alarming.
Behold, the capricious dance of demands,
Shifting sands, holding no stands.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Delivery firm Getir to quit UK, Europe and US and focus on Turkey The grocery courier firm Getir is to quit the UK, Germany, the Netherlands and the US to focus on its home market of Turkey amid heavy competition and waning demand for rapid home deliveries. The closure marks the latest shakeout of the fast grocery delivery industry which grew rapidly during the Covid pandemic but has sharply retreated since. It is not clear". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Delivery firm Getir to quit UK, Europe and US and focus on Turkey The grocery courier firm Getir is to quit the UK, Germany, the Netherlands and the US to focus on its home market of Turkey amid heavy competition and waning demand for rapid home deliveries. The closure marks the latest shakeout of the fast grocery delivery industry which grew rapidly during the Covid pandemic but has sharply retreated since. It is not clear
